title: Definition
context: §332-1 Definition. The term &ldquo;mattress&rdquo; as used in this chapter means any quilted pad, comforter, mattress, mattress-pad, bunk quilt, or cushion, stuffed or filled with wool, hair, or other soft material to be used on a couch or other bed and on which persons sleep or recline; provided that: (1) The term &ldquo;mattress&rdquo; shall not include any items considered &ldquo;beddings&rdquo; under the federal Textile Fiber Products Identification Act (15 United States Code §70 et seq.); and (2) A &ldquo;cushion&rdquo; includes only those that are filled with rubber, feathers, or down. [L 1927, c 234, §1; RL 1935, §1190; RL 1945, §2471; RL 1955, §55-1; HRS §332-1; am L 1988, c 20, §2]
